Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in the centre of BCN”
Reviews.Author: Ben Z Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and cosy albeit mine did not have an external window. I also missed a desk to write, but if you are here just for leisure it should not be an issue. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The price I paid was better than prices for hotels of similar quality and location.

Reviews.Title: “Good staying for a fair price near to Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Bruno_Marinho
Reviews.Content: Difficult to find and the way there is dark and a little dangerous. No breakfast, rooms clean but small.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Pygatea
Reviews.Content: The reception was very helpful, the hotel seems safe, the neighborhood is lovely and right in the middle of the action but not too loud. This hotel is a great value if you are staying in Barcelona for a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised for a 1 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: UniTraveller1
Reviews.Content: Service - excellent. All staff were very friendly. Value - excellent. We booked on booking.com and got a great deal. Sleep Quality - good. Comfortable beds. Noise is a particular problem for light sleepers as other guests may come in quite late from 4-5am. Cleanliness - rooms and bathroom were clean but the bedsheets had clearly not been changed. When we arrived, we found hair strands all over the pillow covers and bedsheets but no stains. As it was late when we arrived, we had to just pick the hair off and deal with it. By the next morning, we weren't fussed anymore. Location - excellent. A couple of minutes walk to La Rambla. Felt safe walking back to the hotel late at night. Rooms - large, basic rooms that were bright and well designed, there was a window in the bedroom and bathroom (we stayed in a triple/quadruple room). No TV but expected for a 1 star. Free fast wi-fi. Travel tips - La Seu Cathedral in the Gothic Quarter (or known as the 'Gothic Cathedral') is a must see. Nearest metro station is Liceu and is a couple of minutes walk from the hotel - you can take the train to La Sagrada Familia (tickets should be purchased the day before to avoid the very long lines - this also applies to any other structures by Gaudi) and Park Guell. Port Vell and the beach is within walking distance of the hotel. Overall impressions - nice, comfortable stay. Great option for budget travelers. We would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you absolutely must sleep one night, but not for longer term.”
Reviews.Author: travellingdudes
Reviews.Content: This is a very very basic hotel with windowless small rooms and fast wireless internet. No tv in room. It is clean and centrally located. However, the air stinks in the room and I would not want to be here for longer than 1 night. If you can get it for under 25 euro it is a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, friendly & great location”
Reviews.Author: Cindy L
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for three nights after reading the reviews here. Valued the pro and con, the price was a big attraction, and the location, and the cleanness... I almost developed claustrophobia when I found out my room 203 without a window, I tried not to look at the four walls directly otherwise I could have passed out. I went to a tour the next day and met a lady on the trip who said her room was so simple and small with a single bed but cost 2.5 times of mine, I immediate thought the air in my room was so fresh! The room was simple but clean and nicely layout, a conformable double bed with two pillows, but I was a little disappointed to find out there wasn’t a bed sheet, I had to sleep on a light blue blanket, it looked clean but no sure how often it gets washed. Reading the reviews here, someone suggest taking ear plugs when staying at hotel Call, how bad it could be I thought, but I wished I listened! It was very bad. I couldn’t hear noise from the street (probably because I didn’t have a window) but every time somebody talked in the hall way or in their room, it was like they were talking directly to me. My room next to the lift, so I was constantly woken up during the night, 1am, 2am, 3am... each time someone came back or went out or moved about, banging, chatting, singing.... !! I had very little sleep during three nights of staying! Hotel Call has a great location, it is near La Rambla – the street you must visit and it is only a few minutes away from the Boqueria market. The night life in Barcelona is so calm and relaxing, walking alone the La Rambla, the shops, bar, restaurant all open until late but you don’t see any drunk people shouting or smashed bottle on the street, people enjoy their lives with style and class. I felt it was quite safe at night because so many tourists walking around on the streets, even 11pm I walked back to the hotel by my own I wasn’t too afraid, but you still need to take a precaution of your own safety when walk alone at night. The cleaning lady saw me leaving the room with my luggage, she opened the lift door for me with a big smile on my face, her smile was so sincere that made me wanting to hug her. Barcelona is such a nice and friendly city, I can’t wait to go back visiting it next time and I will come back to hotel call as the great value it offers and of course will bring a pair of ear plugs with me! If you visit Barcelona don’t forget they use different size of plug to UK, (two pin), buy an adaptor at a poundland shop here cheaper than buying it at airport. Visit Montserrat is a great day/half day out, Stunning view! Finally to everyone, yes, we are on holiday, we are having a good time, but after midnight, can you please have a little consideration of the following guesses and keep your voice/noise down?

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Vix8323
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights & was a great location near to La Ramblas & easy access to the underground. Very clean easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Call - basic but cheap”
Reviews.Author: Ben_Innes
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a roof over your head, which is cheap and in a good location then this place will tick all your boxes. Rooms and very basic, i mean a bed, shower and a toilet is it! But the staff were friendly and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “very basic but the location makes up for all”
Reviews.Author: guyronen
Reviews.Content: this 1 star hotel is located at the heart of central barcelona, in the Gothic quarter. rooms are very small and basic, and there's not enough fresh air around, but if you find a good deal for your stay the location is worth every euro.

Reviews.Title: “value for money,clean and centrally located!”
Reviews.Author: dimitra2011
Reviews.Content: For our first visit in Barcelona we booked hotel call which was bargain for money,and we could spend our money on sightseeing and restaurants rather than for a room which we were gonna use to sleep and shower.I was a bit aware because of how cheap it was,but i would definately recommend it to somebody who goes to visit barcelona city.The hotel is right in heart of everything and walking distance from la ramplas and all bars and restaurant.Easy access to the tube as well.It looks dodgy and scary from outside,but the rooms are well clean(room service everyday),with safety box and quite new furnitures.If you dont expect luxury things,is the best to save your money and enjoy the centre of barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever think of booking at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: prechiel
Reviews.Content: Even until now, I am haunted by the traumatic experience we had in this hotel. A day before our departure, we asked the hotel to arrange a taxi for us going to the airport because we had to be at the airport by 4am. So we had to check out and leave the hotel by 3am. Past 1am, there was a constant loud knocking at our door. When I checked out, there was a man, more of a goon, speaking spanish which I couldn't understand. For fear that some bad element entered the hotel, i immediately slummed the door and locked it. A few more minutes and the goon was still there. Knocking heavily at our door. so I called the reception and asked for help. That arrogant, old receptionist guy demanded that we pay immediately or else the guy wouldn't leave the door and we won;t be able to get our taxi to the airport. WTF!!!!! So my friend and I had no choice but to get down, on our PJs and pay the reception our dues. But up until now, I consider it a nightmare. Imagine demanding you to pay at the wee hours of the morning?! They don't trust their customers. And the way they deal with us is outright unprofessional. I recommend that YOU DON'T STAY HERE if you want your piece of mind. The only good about this hotel is it's location - right at the heart of Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: lizrhodesfitness
Reviews.Content: I stayed at hotel Call for two nights and could not wait to get out of there! The staff was nice and the location is in the heart of the action but that's where the good stuff ends. There are no TV's in the rooms. Our room was on the 2nd floor but we felt like it was in the basement. The tiny window faced a dark alley and you couldn't open the blinds. The room was so hot we could barely sleep! Don't bother trying to charge your cell phone the only 2 outlets are all the way up by the ceiling! ANd the neighborhood was really sketchy at night. For the price I think you can find a much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, bright, convenient and excellent service :)”
Reviews.Author: lokshu
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 nights on my own, I had a double bed in a reasonable sized room, very bright, with a nice ensuit bathroom. The service was very very good, 24hrs reception, they keep the key for you when you leave the hotel so it is very safe. the location of the hotel is excellent! (near cathedral) Clean towels and new bedsheets are provided everyday. The 2 downsides would be that the sound proof of the rooms are not that great, so you can hear people along the hallway or going up and down the stairs quite well. Secondly, if you book a basic room for 1 (like mine) then you will only get a room without a window. Also, try not to wander around the streets after 10pm specially a girl only. Otherwise it was very pleasant staying with them! great value!

Reviews.Title: “For those who aren'tpicky”
Reviews.Author: thybbuk
Reviews.Content: As someone before me has said - location is everything, especially if all you need is a bed to crash and a bathroom to wash off the dirt of the street. Hotel Call offers accomodation at budget rates in a perfect location for those who visit Barcelona to explore the city rather than hang out in air-conditioned lonunges. In brief: the PROS are: location in the Barri - low price - friendly and polite reception (basic command of English proved just enough to avoid any misunderstandings) - air conditioning in rooms (though they sometimes turn it off for periods of anywhere from a quarter of an hour to an hour). The CONS are: thin walls - low average age of guests, who sometimes treat this place as a hostel and have to be reminded it is in fact a hotel - loud room service (late risers - DON'T take rooms 405, 406, 407, 408 - they are located next to the maintenance space). - lack of windows in rooms (yes, though in noisy Barcelona this just as well might be a blessing). The hotel is clean enough. As to the safe - i didn't use it, so it was not robbed, but we left a pricey digital camera in our room a couple of times and we still have it.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent location and accomodations for the money”
Reviews.Author: sirina
Reviews.Content: Located in the very center of Barri Gothic - in the middle of old Jewish area - walking distance to any and every attraction...close-by Metro station...very safe....lots of shopping, eating, drinking and just walking around. Small rooms, very clean, full bathroom with bidet...very friendly and helpful English speaking staff...and you cannot beat the price!!!!!!!!! They are the same company with Condall...so you might check them both...ask for highher floors - streets are narrow and sound travels easy :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mariacaxuxa
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights. The hotel is OK for its value. The staff is very friendly and nice. The rooms are very clean. If I have to return someday I will consider this Hotel again.I stayed

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: manalokos
Reviews.Content: We've stayed for 4 nights, the hotel's location is great, very near the Liceu metro station, in some tiny streets full of shops. The room was good and clean and the staff was very nice and helpfull. For a 1 star hotel, I could not ask anything else.

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: grooviechique
Reviews.Content: hotel call basic but clean, warm, comfortable and quiet. about 5 mins walk from la rambla great location

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Tiffanys01
Reviews.Content: A little scary later at night but perfect location. Would be better with tea making facilities. A little expensive for what it is. Could be quite noisy at night and the room was dark, wasnt sure if it was day or night when we woke up.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nothing to say”
Reviews.Author: rcsmit
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, all was ok. Staff was also friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: HaroldC
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Call in April 2009 and found it to be basic but very clean and excellent value for the price. We had the triple room which is situated so that there was no noise to be heard from other rooms. We could hear people in the hallway coming in at night but once they had reached their rooms there was silence again. The room was spacious enough for three and the bathroom was comfortably large with a bathtub. The linen and bathtowels were changed every day and the overall cleanliness left no room for complaint. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location is almost perfect, close to La Rambla and other attractions. There is no breakfast served but it is easy to find nice cafes nearby and the market hall La Boqueria off La Rambla is a must, also good for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location, but very basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: j_drury
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting a great deal as it is a 1* hotel, but even I was a little disappointed! The rooms were very small, basic but clean. The staff were pleasant enough. It is true about the walls, they are paper thin and when someone takes a shower early in the morning, it does sound like its in your own room! The hotel is in a fantastic location, a minutes walk away from La ramblas and the metro station. If you just want somewhere to sleep and shower when exploring the city, then this hotel is good for that. However, it is situated on the back streets and it can get pretty dark down there on a night, so I wouldn't recommend it for single females. We plan to go back to Barcelona, but we won't be staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not nice at all...”
Reviews.Author: schuminou
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel knowing that it will not be extra comfortable regarding the price. Rooms are small but clean. No television, no segregate lights between restroom and bedroom, ... The staff is quite welcoming but during the night they put the television very high even if I went to the desk 3 times to explain my problem (that they had for sure understood)! Neverthless, the hotel is very well located in a very small and tipical alley and I would recommand it to have fun in Barcelona saving money.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly and Noisy, dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: TravellerBing
Reviews.Content: I am a backpacker so I am used to basic cheap accommodation and usually use hostels but this time I came with my boyfriend so I chose a hotel. There is nothing we liked about this hotel and wish I had paid extra for someting better. The reception staff were not friendly. They didnt speak to us at all and they had no leaflets for information on the area as you would expect in a hotel. Our room was quite unpleasant with a tiny window that looked out onto another wall which was nothing but a tiny gap. It smelled quite bad of sewers which made us feel quite queasy. Worst of all was the noise. The walls are paper thin. When our neighbours decided to have a shower at 4am it might as well have been in our own room! It was so loud. We could also hear their conversations and lots of coughing through the night. The location was good in that it was so close to Ramblas but terrible trying to find the hotel when we got there, and as its up a narrow dark alleyway, I was very frightened and on our last night people attempted to pickpocket us 3 times! If you are looking for budget accomodation like I was, dont stay here! Im sure a hostal would have been much friendlier, less smelly and safer.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but under average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Catherine2210
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and didn't enjoy it at all. The room is tiny and smelly, with an inside window that can not be opened because of other people's smoking, and very thin walls (so that you can hear the conversations in the rooms next to you). The hotel is near to the historic center and La Ramblas, but with the great transportation system (including metro) in Barcelona, it is wiser to take better hotel, not so close to the center.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain central hotel”
Reviews.Author: batboy_nl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a week (august- september 2008) having found it through a booking website at 60 euro per night for an ensuite double. was amazed to find something so cheap in the centre and to be honest its more a 1 plus or 2 minus than just a 1 star. Read all of the reviews prior to going and was expecting something awful - was worried about the size of room, the safe, the rude staff, the cleanliness etc etc but found none of them a problem. Size of room was not really an issue - with city centre hotel at that price you expect compact and it was bigger than we expected - ensuite and room were big enough for two people to move around and get ready etc with no problem. it wasnt like we spent hours in the room other than sleeping so not a problem. the safe we didnt use because of the warning on here but it looked like the standard model used in all the hotels where i've never had a problem the staff worried me - even though we always treat staff well and dont expect the usual problems, we are a gay couple and the reports on the old guy here and others worried me - but they were all fabulous. They treated us with respect and smiles (the latter normally missing in spain :-)). the so called rude old guy chatted and joked with us a couple of times as well and so did the middle aged guy so i really cant see why other people have had problems - of course we did the usual things anyone would do lik elearning to say hello goodbye please and thank you in catalan rather than using english or spanish and i think that helped. in terms of cleanliness i cant see what the fuss was about - very clean with bedding and towels totally changed every day we were there. sure some of the fixtures and fittings were a bit dated but no prob we didnt have trouble with noise other than one morning when 2 of the cleaners woke us up (1030am so not too early) with a loud conversation and the electrical sockets are a problem in their number and location - one at ceiling height for a non existent tv and one in the bathroom - we had to improvise a shelf for our travel kettle but that was no prob - next time i go i'll take an extension lead Overall i would recommend this to other travellers and indeed already have. Next time we go we will use the same place without hesitation. Its very convenient for Liceu metro and the Ramblas Jaume metro and the cathedral. there are some great bars and restaurants within a 10 minute radius and its now added to my list of good clean value for money european city break hotels. I would also really really recommend it for gay travellers on a budget - rather than paying more for the hotels who advertise as gay friendly and charge for it, pick this one where the staff treat everyone with the same level of respect and friendliness as the guests give them .

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Evgeni
Reviews.Content: 4 nights in June. 1* hotel in the heart of the Gotic quarter - 3 minutes to Ramble. We reserved with bookassist web-site for 60Euro for night. The room was small but clean with free safe and bath ensuite. For this price it is the best value that you can find in the centre of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: jmcan73
Reviews.Content: I have read the reviews about Hotel Call and some of them seem that people has not travelled a lot…do you want to pay for a one star hotel and get 5 stars?... I have been in hotels of three stars where the mattress was much worse, where the window was facing a wall and where you could listen noises. In the Hotel Call you will not find luxury rooms but you have a correct room, with private bath and tub, always clean, free safe and helpful people. I was with my girlfriend (she already had been) and we were really well. The location is perfect, next to all the most interesting spots of the city. I have been employed at hotels at several countries and I can say to you that it is an excellent choice for the price, really honest.

Reviews.Title: “It was terrible!!”
Reviews.Author: BarcelonaTrip33
Reviews.Content: I have booked a single room and have invited my girlfriend for 2 hours during the daytime and they wanted the price for a doble room!!! The worst hotel I ve ever been!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal central location.”
Reviews.Author: Nurse51brigg
Reviews.Content: Like many other reviewers, read the reviews AFTER a friend booked it for us.We were very apprehensive. I printed out a map of the hotel's location and arranged our journey from Estacio du Nord (The bus station near Arc de Triomf metro.) by metro (Taxi is reasonable if you can find one that is free) We travelled to Jaume metro. Found the street leading to the Plaka Jaume and the very narrow street to the hotel very easily. (about 2030 at night) I think every spare blank wall in Barcelona has grafitti on it. Which is very sad. Major towns in England are the same. LIke most of the previous reviews my comments would match, rooms clean, beds, changed every day, clean towels, HOT water all the time. Toilet clean. The three men that manned the desk, were always helpful. I speak a little spanish so that went a long way. BUT even if you dont , shouldnt be a problem. Our room was on the third floor near the lift, which we rareley heard. Our small window faced a wall. NOt a problem as it made the room very peaceful and you wouldnt know you were in a very vibrant bustling city. Like a previous reviewer didnt know what the weather was like until we ventured out. I feel sorry for the 2004 person who had there safe robbed, but we had no problems. Its a coded safe, and you just have to remember your code. Warned about pickpockets etc, but you use your noddle, take a bun bag or a zipped bag., and place it in front of you. THe downsides we experienced were, there are NO plug points in the room ( we took a kettle and couldnt use it.) MIssed my early morning cuppa. I couldnt charge up my mobile phone either. The other ,was a fellow English guest waking the whole of the hotel cos he couldnt get into his room. Everyone I think in Barcelona knew his wifes name by the time he finished. Unfortunate for us on our 1st night. He left the same morning . I hasten to add the following 4 nights were peaceful. THe hotel is a few minutes walk from the Ramblas and Liceu Metro. where there are Lots of eating places all competing for customers, cheap and otherwise. So you pays your money and takes your choice. Every morning the streets surrounding the hotel are washed and hosed down. Rubbish is removed every night or early morning. Lots of major tourist sites of easy walking distance from the hotel. Small cafe round the corner for a nice cup of "Cafe con Leche" ot Te con Leche and snacks for breakfast. Metro multi ticket very cheap and covers a large area. Watch the days and times of opening of the sites you want to see. If you have booked a short stay you may miss an attraction you want to see because its not open the days you have booked. IE the Magic fountain at Mont Juic which is only on Thurs, FRi Sat and Sun. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Suitable to stay for a visit to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: carlaGuimar_es
Reviews.Content: We were two couples with one children each. At first, when we arrived in front of the hotel, we felt disappointed because it looks very old and the building is in ruins (a bit), but as we got into the hotel, that bad image completely faded. Its inside has been rebuilt, it has air conditioning, it's clean, quiet, the rooms are ok, although our windows were faced to a wall. It has a good location (near La Rambla, the Cathedral and the Liceu metro station). In La Rambla there are many cheap places to eat, like McDonald's, KFC, Pans, etc. To conclude, it's suitable for someone who is visiting Barcelona city.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: wickedcheck
Reviews.Content: We went there for two nights, and had no problems at all, the staff was very friendly (even the one at night, he called a taxi at 5 in the morning for us). OK, the rooms are very minimalistic, some have just a tiny "window", but everything is clean and tidy. The cleaning lady even folded my clothes : ) A good budget hotel for a couple of nights. You'll need some adaptation if you're used to hotels with 2 or more stars.

Reviews.Title: “What do you expect?”
Reviews.Author: BigBlackFeet
Reviews.Content: Looked for and found something cheap and clean. 4 Nights in Barca. How much time do actually spend in the room? No need for TV but a kettle to make a cup of tea or coffe would be nice. Clean and tidy. No outside window but then no street noise either. Tiled floors and no carpeting meant noisy corridors but I have spent time in far noisier Hotels. Overall I would say good value. Experience would have been improved if the 'grumpy old man' had not been on the reception but small price to pay...... Would we go back? At the price and with its location I say yes.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Call
HotelInfo.Address: Arc de Sant Ramon del Call, 4, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
